programme.title: Street Smart
programme.desc: Morgan Freeman stars as a pimp who gets mistaken for a fictional pimp in a journalist's story.

programme.title: Freelancers
programme.desc: The son of a slain NYPD officer joins the force, where he falls in with a team of rogue cops.

programme.title: The Mighty Quinn
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as a cop working to clear his friend's name of murder and theft.

programme.title: Gang in Blue
programme.desc: Mario Van Peebles plays a cop uncovering white supremacist vigilantes in his department. Josh Brolin co-stars.

programme.title: Civil Brand
programme.desc: The inmates at a notorious women's prison band together to fight for reform.

programme.title: Bojangles
programme.desc: Follow Bill "Mr. Bojangles" Robinson (Gregory Hines) rising from vaudeville to a legendary entertainer.

programme.title: Holiday Heart
programme.desc: Ving Rhames plays a drag queen who cares for a drug addict (Alfre Woodard) and helps raise her daughter.

programme.title: Cooley High
programme.desc: Chicago, 1964: Two teens navigate the end of high school in this authentic portrait of Black youth.

programme.title: Breakin' 2: Electric Boogaloo
programme.desc: A developer tries to bulldoze a community recreation center and local breakdancers try to stop it.

programme.title: Running Scared
programme.desc: Billy Crystal and Gregory Hines play two Chicago cops who must team up to pursue a drug dealer.

programme.title: The Mighty Quinn
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as a cop working to clear his friend's name of murder and theft.

programme.title: Leprechaun In the Hood
programme.desc: When three rappers want to get even with a pimp, they unleash a leprechaun who goes on a killing rampage.

programme.title: Leprechaun VI: Back 2 Tha Hood
programme.desc: A woman discovers a chest of gold only to discover that the treasure belongs to an evil leprechaun.

programme.title: Never 2 Big
programme.desc: A music industry executive tries to uncover the truth behind a singer's murder.
